relation: There is a huge dining hall and a mulitude of different shops throughout the campus.
Out of all the colleges I have visited Canisius does have some very nice dorms and the RA's are always there to help assist you and your living conditions.
Canisius College will push you to do your best, it is not easy but it is worth the while.
Get to know your professors and go to their office hours if you need help, they are always willing to help you.

Canisius College is a very personable inviting college that compliments the learning process in a multitude of ways. All of the professors here are fully knowledgeable and are willing to help at all times. I simply love this college and it has helped me further my education immensely.
pageTitle: Canisius College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {202072=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 161056=Get your application in early! The earlier your application is in and you make your deposit, the more housing options you have. If you qualify for honors or are interested in service, you can live on the honors or Ignatian floors. These two floors are in the freshman hall that was built in 2008. They are modern and very spacious. Another benefit is that they are air-conditioned. Another tip is if you have taken college classes in high school, send them to the college to see if they transfer. The more core requirements you can get out of the way, the faster you can start working on the classes that really count towards your major.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Damon from Buffalo, NY 09/13/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 2 of 42 Categories Comments Great for these types of students The school has a great Psychology department, most teachers I spoke to in high school knew this school for this department. Also, the two classes I took so far in this department have both being very engaging. Tips for prospective students If you can, I'd suggest getting into a two year school to cover all the basics for less then applying here. The Jesuits schools are suppose to be very good as a name to get jobs with, but as this is only student hearsay, take it with caution. Bang for the buck Not initially showing it's worth unless you can get most of it paid for. The higher classes may prove to make all of this worth it but the starting classes are sub-par in my opinion.
